intro: Phanera apertilobata, commonly known as the narrow-lobed phanera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The fruit is a capsule that releases small, hairy seeds when mature.
